body: `--run_under` is reset in the exec configuration (https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/refs/heads/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/analysis/config/CoreOptions.java;l=973;drc=93cd68dd788b62c9a51244fd475b456913e44476;bpv=1;bpt=1), which makes me think this would be solved by https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/18002.

rename.from: --experimental_output_directory_naming_scheme=diff_against_baseline caused Bazel to rebuild whenever --run_under changes
rename.to: --experimental_output_directory_naming_scheme=diff_against_baseline caused Bazel to rebuild whenever --run_under or --test_env change

issue.title: Use output directory naming scheme `diff_against_dynamic_baseline`

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Compared to `diff_against_baseline`, this mode improves caching when top-level flags change that are reset in the exec configuration.

Fixes #18480

body:
Do you still see this behavior when using `diff_against_dynamic_baseline`?

This is a bit peculiar as I would not expected a difference in analysis behavior due to that flag. In particular changes to either `run_under` and `test_env` would invalidate the analysis cache regardless of the setting of `experimental_output_directory_naming_scheme`.

Are you consistently seeing analysis cache discards but a difference in action cache behavior? If so, changing to `diff_against_dynamic_baseline` should fix the issue. (Technically, only for actions after an exec transition but actions before one should not have been exhibiting that issue anyways.)
@sdtwigg Based on https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/18480#issuecomment-1684669608, could we proceed with the merge of #18561?
Yes, this looks all together now and was hoping to do the merge today or so.
